problems.description: Implement the merge sort algorithm for the given input array
problems.inputs description: Input consists of an array of unsorted array. It may be of arbitrary length.
problems.expected description: An array of numbers e.g. 1,2,4,5 sorted in ascending orders

problems.problem name: Count Inversion Pairs using Merge Sort
problems.description: Modify the merge sort algorithm to count the number of inversions in the array. An inversion is a pair of indices (i, j) such that i < j and arr[i] > arr[j]. Your solution must be O(n log n)
problems.inputs description: The input is an array of integers representing the elements of the array. The array can be of any length.
problems.expected description: An integer representing the number of inversion pairs in the array.

problems.description: Modify the merge sort algorithm to sort an array such that the elements are sorted in alternating order: the smallest element first, the largest element second, the second smallest element third, the second largest element fourth, and so on.
problems.inputs description: The input is an array of integers. The array can be of any length.
problems.expected description: An array sorted in alternating order: the smallest element first, the largest element second, the second smallest element third, the second largest element fourth, and so on.
